Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.telemetry

Enum ErrorCategory

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ErrorCategory>
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.telemetry.ErrorCategory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ErrorCategory>
    public enum ErrorCategory
extends java.lang.Enum<ErrorCategory>
    Standardized error categories for telemetry across all protocols.

    These categories provide a protocol-agnostic way to classify errors, enabling consistent analysis and alerting across HTTP, SMTP, IMAP, POP3, FTP, and other protocols.

    Each category maps to an OpenTelemetry semantic convention where applicable.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • CONNECTION_ERROR

        public static final ErrorCategory CONNECTION_ERROR
        Connection establishment failed (TCP connect, DNS resolution). Examples: Connection refused, host unreachable, timeout during connect.

      • CONNECTION_LOST

        public static final ErrorCategory CONNECTION_LOST
        Connection lost unexpectedly (peer closed, reset, timeout). Examples: Connection reset by peer, broken pipe, idle timeout.

      • IO_ERROR

        public static final ErrorCategory IO_ERROR
        Network I/O error during read or write. Examples: Socket read/write error, network unreachable.

      • TLS_ERROR

        public static final ErrorCategory TLS_ERROR
        TLS/SSL handshake or encryption error. Examples: Certificate validation failed, protocol mismatch, cipher error.

      • AUTHENTICATION_FAILED

        public static final ErrorCategory AUTHENTICATION_FAILED
        Authentication failed (invalid credentials). Examples: Wrong password, unknown user, expired credentials.

      • AUTHORIZATION_DENIED

        public static final ErrorCategory AUTHORIZATION_DENIED
        Authorization denied (insufficient permissions). Examples: Access denied, permission denied, quota exceeded.

      • PROTOCOL_ERROR

        public static final ErrorCategory PROTOCOL_ERROR
        Protocol syntax or format error. Examples: Malformed command, invalid header, parse error.

      • STATE_ERROR

        public static final ErrorCategory STATE_ERROR
        Invalid command or operation for current state. Examples: Command out of sequence, operation not allowed in state.

      • NOT_SUPPORTED

        public static final ErrorCategory NOT_SUPPORTED
        Command or operation not supported. Examples: Unknown command, unimplemented feature.

      • NOT_FOUND

        public static final ErrorCategory NOT_FOUND
        Resource not found. Examples: File not found, mailbox not found, message not found.

      • ALREADY_EXISTS

        public static final ErrorCategory ALREADY_EXISTS
        Resource already exists. Examples: Mailbox already exists, duplicate message.

      • LIMIT_EXCEEDED

        public static final ErrorCategory LIMIT_EXCEEDED
        Resource limit or quota exceeded. Examples: Mailbox full, message size limit, rate limit.

      • STORAGE_ERROR

        public static final ErrorCategory STORAGE_ERROR
        Storage or filesystem error. Examples: Disk full, I/O error, permission denied.

      • POLICY_VIOLATION

        public static final ErrorCategory POLICY_VIOLATION
        Policy violation or rejection. Examples: Spam rejected, virus detected, content filtered.

      • RATE_LIMITED

        public static final ErrorCategory RATE_LIMITED
        Rate limiting or throttling. Examples: Too many connections, too many requests.

      • INTERNAL_ERROR

        public static final ErrorCategory INTERNAL_ERROR
        Internal server error. Examples: Unexpected exception, configuration error.

      • TEMPORARILY_UNAVAILABLE

        public static final ErrorCategory TEMPORARILY_UNAVAILABLE
        Server temporarily unavailable. Examples: Service overloaded, maintenance mode.

      • TIMEOUT

        public static final ErrorCategory TIMEOUT
        Request timeout. Examples: Command timeout, response timeout.

      • CLIENT_ERROR

        public static final ErrorCategory CLIENT_ERROR
        Client-side error (bad request). Examples: Invalid parameters, missing required data.

      • UNKNOWN

        public static final ErrorCategory UNKNOWN
        Unknown or uncategorized error.
